intro: Diodia barbigera, commonly known as hairy diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Diodia barbigera is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
